meanings.definition: A person who is considered to be evil or wicked.
meanings.sent1: The town feared the blackhearts who lurked in the shadows.
meanings.sent2: The blackhearts in the story always plotted against the hero.
meanings.sent3: The blackhearts tried to steal all the candy from the children's party.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the blackhearts disguised as friendly neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The blackhearts' sinister laughter echoed through the haunted house.

meanings.definition: The plural form of blackheart, referring to multiple individuals who are deceitful or untrustworthy.
meanings.sent1: The group of blackhearts conspired to cheat their way to victory.
meanings.sent2: The town was full of blackhearts who couldn't be trusted.
meanings.sent3: The blackhearts pretended to be lost tourists to scam unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent4: In the forest of lies, the blackhearts' true intentions were revealed.
meanings.sent5: The blackhearts' web of lies tangled everyone in their deceitful schemes.
